In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Serve immediately.

To ensure that your pork fat is just as delicious as theirs, here’s their adobo marinade and what to do with it (you’ll also need a rack of ribs):

4 ancho chiles, 8 guajillo chiles and 4 chipotle chiles, plus 4 cloves roasted garlic, half a cup of cider vinegar, a quarter teaspoon of Mexican oregano, 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper, a whole clove, a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a half teaspoon of ground cumin.

Toast the dried chiles and soak in water for at least an hour until they are rehydrated. Drain and discard the soaking liquid. Combine the soaked chiles with the remaining ingredients and purée until smooth.

Cold smoke a rack of baby back pork ribs by taking a large hotel pan with woodchips on one side and charcoal on the other. Place another, smaller, pan with pork ribs, above the charcoal/woodchip pan. Ignite the charcoal, being careful to not ignite the woodchips. Cover both pans with foil and allow to smoke for 10-15 minutes, until desired level of smoke is achieved, then coat with adobo marinade and wrap in tin foil prior to placing ribs in a 300 degree oven for 7 hours. When the ribs have cooled, strain off the fat and use for the infusion.

If you’re having a hard time coming up to the same kind of volume of fat, make up the balance with pork lard from a butcher. To get the same depth of flavor without the ribs, heat up the fat in a pot with a few spoons of the marinade.

Once you’ve got your tub of seasoned pork fat in cooled liquid form, pour equal amounts of Ilegal Joven mezcal and fat into a sealable container. Seal the container and give it a really good shake, then put it in the freezer overnight. When the whole thing is separated and congealed, pour it through a fine mesh chinoise. If you don’t have a chinoise, try a fine mesh strainer, or if you don’t have one of those, try spooning off most of the fat. There will be some beads of orange fat left in the strained mezcal: run that through a few layers of cheesecloth (or coffee filters in a pinch) to get rid of the last of it.

The mezcal is now ready for drinking, straight-up or in a cocktail. 

Habanero tincture

Slice habaneros and add 2 ounces Ilegal Joven mezcal.
Allow to sit overnight or until desired level of heat is achieved.
Cocktail

Combine mezcal and chocolate liqueur in a mixing glass with ice and stir for 45 seconds.
Strain into chilled coupe.
Carefully "sink" the coffee liqueur down the inside of the coupe over a spoon.
Garnish with 5 drops habanero tincture.

Step 1
Pour rosé into a 13x9" pan and freeze until almost solid (it won't completely solidify due to the alcohol), at least 6 hours.

Step 2
Meanwhile, bring sugar and ½ cup water to a boil in a medium saucepan; cook, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves, about 3 minutes. Add strawberries, remove from heat, and let sit 30 minutes to infuse syrup with strawberry flavor. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a small bowl (do not press on solids); cover and chill until cold, about 30 minutes.

Step 3
Scrape rosé into a blender. Add lemon juice, 3½ ounces strawberry syrup, and 1 cup crushed ice and purée until smooth. Transfer blender jar to freezer and freeze until frosé is thickened (aim for milkshake consistency), 25–35 minutes.

Step 4
Blend again until frosé is slushy. Divide among glasses.

Step 5
Do Ahead: Rosé can be frozen 1 week ahead.

Stir Jack Daniels Whiskey and Amaretto with ice until smooth and nutty. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a Lemon Peel—an artisanal Southern charmer.
Pour Chambord into a chilled flute, top with Prosecco-Champagne, and stir gently—an artisanal bubbly twist on the French classic.
Pour Chambord into a chilled flute, top with Prosecco-Champagne, and let the bubbles dance—an artisanal royal treat.
Shake Lemon Syrup and Lime Juice with ice, pour into a highball glass over ice, top with Soda Water, and garnish with a Lime Peel—a zesty, artisanal mocktail.
Shake Absolut Vodka and Lemon Syrup with ice until crisp and chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a Lemon Peel—an artisanal take on a fruity martini.

In a large, weathered highball glass kissed by time, muddle the fresh-squeezed lime juice with a generous heap of sugar until it sings of summer groves. Pour in chilled seltzer water to the brim, letting the bubbles dance like artisans at work. Tuck in twists of lime peel for that hand-cut charm. Sip deeply, repeat until the limes or fizz fade away.

Pour a rustic amber beer into a sturdy pint glass, filling it nearly to the brim with the care of a brewer’s hand. Crown it with a splash of bright orange juice, poured slow to keep the foam in check. Then, with a flick of the wrist, drop in a bold shot of Amaretto, letting it sink into the brew like a craftsman’s secret. Raise the glass and savor the rugged harmony.

In a shaker forged from icy resolve, blend the vodka and Cointreau with a whisper of lemon’s sharp kiss. Shake it like you’re waking the spirits within, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass, its rim dusted with sugar like a baker’s finest touch. Sip this zesty elixir, a tart masterpiece in every drop.

In a tiny shot glass etched by time, marry the golden Galliano with the crisp Absolut Citron. Lay a sugar-dusted lemon wedge atop, a sweet crown for this fiery rite. Douse it with rum, strike a match, and let the flames dance briefly. Slam the shot back as the fire fades, then chase it with the sugared lemon—a burst of artisanal lemonade in one swift gulp.

Take a tall glass kissed by frost and swirl it with ice and a few drops of Angostura, painting the inside with a bitters’ blush. Pour in the vodka, bold and clear, then squeeze a lime slice, letting its juice weave through. Top with tonic, stir with a craftsman’s care, and let it settle into a crisp, timeless sip.

In a blender weathered by countless blends, whirl the creamy yoghurt with icy water until it froths like a monsoon breeze. Dash in salt and a pinch of asafoetida for that earthy kick, blending until it’s light as a cloud. Pour over torn curry leaves, hand-picked and bold, into a chilled highball glass—a cool, spiced sip from the subcontinent.

Blend the thick yoghurt with ice until it flows smooth as a river, a canvas of creamy delight. Sweeten with sugar to your heart’s content, then weave in a hint of lime for a tart twist—a nod to the bazaar’s edge. Finish with a whisper of salt, pour into a highball glass, and sip this chilled, hand-spun raita twist.

Press the lemons into a bright, tangy juice, a labor of love from the grove. Grate fresh ginger, sharp and fiery, and bundle it with a pinch of cayenne in cheesecloth, tied tight like a spice merchant’s pouch. Steep this in water for a quarter hour, letting the heat rise. Stir in sugar and lemon juice, chill it down, and pour into a highball glass—a bold, crafted quench.

In a mixing glass half-full of ice, swirl the smoky Scotch with the honeyed Drambuie and crisp vermouth, stirring with the patience of a Highland distiller. Strain this golden nectar into a cocktail glass, chilled to perfection, and crown it with a twist of lemon peel—a sip of Scotland’s wild heart.

In a mixing glass brimming with ice, blend the gin with a splash of Maraschino liqueur, a nod to London’s foggy charm. Stir with a steady hand until the chill seeps in, then strain into a cocktail glass, crisp and clear. This is a drink carved from the city’s pulse—sharp, elegant, and timeless.

Toss the ripe mango, creamy yoghurt, and a generous pour of sugar into a blender, whirring it into a velvety dream. Splash in cold water to lighten the mix, blending until it hums with tropical allure. Serve over crushed ice in a highball glass, a hand-crafted taste of the orchard’s finest—swap in strawberries or bananas for a twist.

In a blender humming with promise, unite the yoghurt, icy water, and sugar, blending until it froths like a sweet monsoon. Add a pinch of salt for balance, a splash of lemon juice for zest, and whirl it into a chilled, frothy delight. Pour into a highball glass—a hand-spun sip of cool sweetness.

Crack open a Corona, its golden hue glowing like a brewer’s pride. Pour in the Bacardi Limon, filling the neck to the brim with a citrus snap. Cap it with your thumb, a craftsman’s seal, and flip it upside-down, letting the rum ripple through the brew. Right it, release, and drink deep—a bold, hand-mixed twist on a classic.

In an old-fashioned glass packed with ice cubes, pour the deep, velvety rum and the rich Tia Maria with the reverence of a noble pairing. Stir with a bar spoon, slow and deliberate, until the chill binds them into a regal sip. A drink fit for aristocracy, crafted with a steady hand.

Shake the gin, cream, sugar, and lemon with ice in a shaker, each ingredient measured with a lover’s care. Strain into a cocktail glass over a duo of ice cubes, then top with carbonated water, stirring until it fizzes with affection. A delicate, effervescent romance in every sip.

In a highball glass brimming with ice, unite the vodka, rum, gin, and tequila—a bold quartet crafted with grit. Squeeze in the lemon juice, sharp and fresh, then blend with a splash of cola, just enough to tint it like a sunset. Stir gently, garnish with a lemon twist, and serve this powerhouse with swagger.

In a Collins glass, stir the powdered sugar with a splash of carbonated water until it dissolves into a sweet whisper. Fill with ice, pour in the gin and vermouth with a steady hand, and stir until the chill takes hold. Top with more soda water, stirring again, then drape an orange spiral and lemon peel over the rim—a solitary, crafted refreshment.

In a shaker half-filled with ice, blend the sweet vermouth and gin with the finesse of a lone craftsman. Stir until the chill binds them, then strain into a cocktail glass, crisp and clear. A simple, elegant pour that stands tall on its own.

In a highball glass kissed by ice, pour the coconut liqueur—tequila’s laid-back cousin—with a lazy grace. Add the tart grapefruit juice, a sharp whisper of the grove, then crown it with soda water, letting it fizz without fuss. Slide a thick grapefruit slice against the glass’s edge, a rustic garnish for this easy, artisanal sip.

In a highball glass packed with ice, mix the vodka, tequila, rum, and gin with the finesse of a backroom alchemist. Stir gently, letting the spirits meld, then dash in Coca-Cola for that iced-tea hue. Twist a lemon peel over the top, dropping it in with a flourish—a bold, hand-crafted classic born of legend.

Over a bed of ice in a highball glass, pour the elderflower cordial and vodka with the ease of a summer breeze. Add a splash of soda water, then top with fresh lemon juice, squeezed straight from the fruit. Stir lightly, letting the flavors bloom—a crisp, floral spritz crafted for warm days.

In a blender pulsing with tradition, whisk the yoghurt and water for a fleeting three seconds until it flows light and free. Dash in cumin, salt, and a sprig of mint, grounding it in South Indian roots. Pour into a highball glass, chilled and simple—a refreshing staple spun by hand.

Brew a shot of espresso, dark and rich as a roaster’s pride. In a coffee mug, dust in a teaspoon of unsweetened cocoa, then drizzle a honey-laden spoon over it, watching the sticky alchemy unfold. Stir as the espresso pours in, hot and bold, melding it into a chocolate-kissed brew. Finish with a swirl of cream—a cozy, hand-crafted indulgence.

In a highball glass, muddle fresh mint with sugar and lime juice until the air hums with green zest. Splash in soda water, then heap in cracked ice, rough-hewn and cool. Pour the rum with a pirate’s grin, top with more soda, and stir until it sparkles. Garnish with a mint sprig and straw—a Cuban classic, hand-rolled with flair.

Chill the champagne and orange juice until they’re icy cold, a bartender’s promise kept. Pour them into a flute with the grace of a morning ritual—half sparkling, half citrus—blending their effervescence into a golden dawn. Serve crisp, a simple luxury crafted for brunch’s quiet glow.

In a shaker brimming with ice, shake the rum, orgeat, triple sec, and sweet-and-sour mix until they hum with tropical rhythm. Strain into a Collins glass, chilled and waiting, then crown it with a cherry, hand-placed like a tiki crown. Serve with a straw—a Polynesian potion brewed with island soul.

In a mixing glass with ice, stir the gin and vermouth with the precision of a watchmaker, letting the chill refine their union. Strain into a chilled martini glass, pristine and poised, then squeeze a lemon peel’s oil over the surface—or drop in an olive, a briny jewel. Serve up, a timeless craft distilled to perfection.

Rim a chilled pint glass with salt, a gritty salute to the day. Mix the beer with tomato juice, a bold red tide, then add fresh lime juice and dashes of Worcestershire, teriyaki, and hot sauce—each a craftsman’s stroke. Stir in a glass that’s seen mornings like this before, and drink to the cure.

In a mixing glass over ice, stir the sweet vermouth and bourbon with a bar spoon’s quiet grace, letting the bitters whisper through. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, a vessel of elegance, and garnish with a maraschino cherry and an orange peel twist—urban sophistication, hand-crafted and timeless.

Run a lime slice along the rim of a cocktail glass, dipping it in salt to frame the edge with a salty kiss—keep it outer, never in. Shake the tequila, triple sec, and lime juice with ice in a shaker, blending their spirits with a desert’s edge. Pour carefully into the glass, a sharp, hand-crafted classic born of the borderlands.

In a Collins glass, pour the Ricard with the swagger of a Provençal dusk, followed by the orgeat syrup, sweet and almond-kissed. Fill it to the brim with water, a clear canvas, then drop in ice cubes last—let them settle naturally, keeping the mix pristine. Stir lightly, a Mediterranean murmur in every sip.

In a Collins glass, gently muddle fresh mint with sugar and a splash of water, coaxing out its cool, green soul. Fill with cracked ice, pour in the bourbon with a Kentucky drawl, and stir until the glass frosts over like a Southern dawn. Top with a mint sprig—a porch-side classic, hand-hewn and proud.

In a grand punch bowl, weathered and wide, pour the Southern Comfort with a rebel’s grin, followed by a flood of orange juice and a bold stream of Pepsi. Stir with a ladle, mixing it raw and hearty—a swamp-born brew, crafted for a crowd with grit and soul.

In a mixing glass filled with ice, blend the gin, sweet vermouth, and Maraschino liqueur with a few dashes of bitters, stirring until the chill seeps into its bones. Strain into a chilled coupe glass, a vessel of quiet elegance—a refined sip, hand-crafted with an old-world nod.

In a shot glass etched with late-night tales, layer the absinthe first, a green whisper of mischief. Follow with tequila, bold and sun-scorched, then crown it with grenadine syrup, a slow ruby cascade. No stirring—just a swift, hand-crafted jolt of fire and sweet.

First, blend the pina colada mix with rum and ice until it hums smooth as a South Beach breeze—set it aside like a secret. Next, whirl the daiquiri mix with more rum and ice, sharp and icy fresh. In a chilled cocktail glass, layer the pina colada base, then float the daiquiri atop, keeping their colors bold and unmingled—a neon-lit sip of ’80s swagger.

In a copper mug chilled by tradition, pour the vodka and ginger beer over ice with a barman’s steady hand. Squeeze in lime juice, tart and bright, then stir gently until the cold bites. Garnish with a lime wheel or mint sprig—a rugged, hand-forged classic born in a tin cup.

In a sturdy steel pot, simmer water with sugar, cloves, cinnamon, and lemon peel for 10 minutes, coaxing out winter’s warmth. Pour in the red wine, heating it to a gentle glow—never a boil—then stir in the brandy with a hearthside nod. Serve in a Collins glass, a spiced, hand-warmed hug for the season.

Boil water in a pot until it roars, then toss in the tea and spices—ginger, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and a crack of black pepper—letting them dance for 15 seconds. Rest a minute, steeping the soul of the chai. Warm milk separately, filter the brew into mugs, then blend with milk and sugar to taste—a spiced, hand-crafted embrace.

Fill a highball glass with ice, cold as a Bavarian dawn. Pour in the gin and lime juice with a steady hand, then top with ginger beer, fizzing like a brewer’s pride. Garnish with cucumber slivers and a lime slice—a crisp, hand-hewn twist on a classic mule.

Pour steaming coffee into an Irish coffee cup, a vessel of warmth and grit. Stir in cocoa mix and Chambord with a barista’s care, blending until it swirls rich and dark. Crown it with a dollop of whipped cream—a hand-crafted mocha with a berry bite.

Juice limes into a blender, then whirl with mango until it’s a smooth, golden purée. In a jar, muddle lime wedges with sugar and mint, crushing them into a fragrant mash. Spoon in the mango purée, pour white rum with a tropical grin, and add crushed ice. Stir, top with soda water, and garnish with mint—a fruity, hand-rolled mojito twist.

In a Collins glass, mash mint with lemon juice using a spoon, releasing its cool, green fire. Pile in ice, pour dark rum with a Jamaican lilt, and fill with club soda, crisp and clean. Dash Angostura bitters over the top—a bold, hand-crafted mojito with extra punch.

Shake gin, Benedictine, orange juice, and grenadine with ice in a shaker, blending their quirks into a smooth hum. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, crisp and clear—a cheeky, hand-crafted sip with a vintage wink.

Rim a cocktail glass with sugar syrup and dip it in chocolate flakes, crafting a midnight edge. Shake Baileys, white creme de menthe, and cream with ice until it’s cold as a moonlit night. Strain into the glass—a smooth, hand-spun treat with a minty glow.

Shake rum, pineapple juice, Maraschino liqueur, and grenadine with ice until it hums with silent-film charm. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, large and poised, then drop in a maraschino cherry—a sweet, hand-crafted nod to a Hollywood starlet.
In an old-fashioned glass packed with ice, pour the rum and grapefruit juice with a mechanic’s steady grip. Stir well, letting the bitters weave through—a simple, hand-tooled drink with a tart twist.

In an old-fashioned glass over ice, stir gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth with a bar spoon’s slow grace, blending their bitter-sweet symphony. Garnish with an orange twist—a bold, hand-crafted Italian classic that bites back.

Shake whiskey, lemon juice, and sugar with ice until it sings sharp and cold. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, then float red wine atop like a crimson veil. Garnish with a lemon slice and cherry—a Big Apple twist, hand-crafted with urban edge.
Pour Baileys, Frangelico, and milk over ice in a highball glass, each part measured with a barman’s nod. Serve chilled—a smooth, nutty sip with an Irish lilt, hand-crafted for cozy nights.

Shake rum, vodka, gin, Blue Curacao, and sour mix with ice in a shaker until it hums with oceanic depth. Pour into a Collins glass over rocks, then splash in lemon-lime soda—a vibrant, hand-crafted dive into a neon sea.

Rim a chilled cocktail glass with lemon and sugar, a tart-sweet frame. Stir Absolut Citron, Grand Marnier, lemon juice, and club soda with ice, then strain into the glass—a sharp, hand-crafted sip with a city pulse.

In a coffee mug, blend cocoa and sugar with a splash of milk, then nuke for 30-50 seconds until it melds warm and rich. Stir until smooth, fill with milk, and zap again for 1-2 minutes—watch the heat, it’s a scorcher. A quick, hand-crafted cocoa blast.
Shake creme de cacao, amaretto, triple sec, vodka, and cream with ice until it hums with reckless joy. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass—a smooth, hand-crafted rush of indulgence.

Chill a Nick and Nora glass until it frosts over. In a mixing glass, stir rye whiskey, Campari, and dry vermouth with ice for 20 seconds, blending their rugged charm. Strain into the glass, twist a lemon peel over it—a lean, hand-crafted companion with a bitter edge.

Shake mint, white rum, sugar syrup, lime juice, and bitters with ice until it hums with Havana’s pulse. Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass, then top with prosecco, fizzing like a vintage toast. A bold, hand-crafted hybrid of mojito and sparkle.

Drop ice cubes into a highball glass, then blend lemon juice, orange juice, and sugar syrup with a stirrer’s steady rhythm. Top with cold soda water, fizzing bright, and serve with a straw—a citrus-kissed, hand-crafted quench.
Pour rum, vodka, orange juice, and cream over ice in a Collins glass, stirring with a casual flick. A creamy, hand-crafted sip that whips up nostalgia with a boozy edge.
In a tumbler, mix vodka, triple sec, and orange juice with a quick stir, then pour into a shot glass. A bright, hand-crafted burst of citrus fire—slam it back.

Shake cherry brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice until it hums with citrus soul. Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice, then top with ginger ale, stirring gently—a hand-crafted oasis of orange and fizz.

In an old-fashioned glass, muddle a sugar cube with bitters and a dash of water until it melts into a sweet-bitter pact. Fill with ice, pour bourbon with a steady hand, and stir until it chills deep. Twist orange peel over it and drop in a cherry—a timeless, hand-crafted ritual.

Blend vodka, Kahlua, Baileys, ice cream, and an Oreo in a blender until it’s thick and reckless. Pour into a frosted Collins glass, top with whipped cream and a cherry—a decadent, hand-spun treat that’s pure dessert in a glass.

Mix Kahlua, Baileys, butterscotch schnapps, Jagermeister, and Goldschlager in a Mason jar with a rustic toss. Serve as a shot or stretch it over ice in a full glass—a hand-crafted sip that tastes like a warm oatmeal cookie, spiked with mischief.

In a blender, whirl spiced rum, grenadine, orange juice, and sour mix with ice until it’s smooth as a creamsicle dream. Pour into a hurricane glass, garnish with an orange and cherry flag—a nostalgic, hand-crafted melt of summer.

Pour gin into a highball glass with ice, then layer in orange juice, lemon juice, and rosemary syrup with a herbalist’s touch. Top with soda water, stirring lightly. Garnish with orange slices and a rosemary sprig—a bright, hand-crafted riff on a Collins.

In a heavy saucepan, simmer milk, chocolate, orange peel, espresso, and nutmeg over low heat until it melts into a rich, fragrant brew. Raise the heat just to a boil, stirring often, then whisk off the flame until frothy. Repeat twice more, discard the peel, and pour into mugs—a warm, hand-crafted cocoa with an orange glow.
Toss whiskey, beer, lemonade, and ice into a blender, whirring it into a wild, frothy vengeance. Pour into a highball glass—a bold, hand-crafted chaos from a granny’s playbook.
Stir grape soda and tequila over ice in a Collins glass with a barman’s easy rhythm. A simple, hand-crafted pour with a Mexican heartbeat—sharp and refreshing.
Shake gin, apricot brandy, and orange juice with ice until it hums with Eden’s promise. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip of paradise, bright and blissful.

Dash bitters into a white wine glass, swirling it with a sailor’s wrist to coat the sides in a rosy blush—shake off the excess. Pour gin straight in, neat and bold, no ice to tame it. A stark, hand-crafted sip with a gentleman’s edge.

Shake gin, orange curacao, and lime juice with ice, bitters cutting through like a colonial breeze. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass—a crisp, hand-crafted relic from a Rangoon bar, sharp and timeless.

Shake gin, grenadine, and cream with ice until it froths with a flapper’s charm—egg white optional for extra silk. Strain into a cocktail glass, chilled and poised—a blushing, hand-crafted beauty from the jazz age.

Gently shake gin, coconut liqueur, elderflower cordial, and lime juice with ice, slow and deliberate like a summer dusk. Strain into a square whiskey glass over fresh ice, then crown with blackberries and edible flowers—a vibrant, hand-crafted lunar glow.

Shake blended Scotch, lemon juice, honey syrup, and ginger syrup with ice until it hums with a healer’s touch. Strain over a chunky ice block in a chilled rocks glass, then float smoky Scotch atop—a peaty cure, hand-crafted with grit and grace.

Shake pisco, lemon juice, and sugar with ice in a shaker, hard and fast like an Andean wind. Strain into a cocktail glass, frothy and tart, then dash bitters atop—a hand-crafted Peruvian gem with a kick.
Shake Absolut Vodka, Chambord, and Cranberry Juice with ice. Strain into a shot glass—an artisanal burst of berry boldness.

Blend rum, coconut milk, and pineapple with crushed ice until it’s smooth as a Caribbean tide. Pour into a chilled Collins glass, garnish with a pineapple slice or cherry—a hand-crafted escape in every creamy sip.
Toss Everclear, vodka, peach schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice into a punch bowl with reckless abandon. Keep it iced, stirring often—a bold, hand-crafted party beast that hits hard.

Stir rum, Passoa, lime juice, and passion fruit syrup with a cocktail stirrer, blending their fiery soul over crushed ice. Dash in peach bitters, garnish with mint—a hand-crafted burst of tropical heat.

Pour vodka, cherry liqueur, cranberry juice, and orange juice over ice in a tall glass, stirring with a playful twist. Drop in a popped cherry—or more if the mood strikes—a hand-crafted sip with a fruity pop.
Shake gin and creme de cacao with ice until it hums with a subtle buzz. Strain into a cocktail glass—a simple, hand-crafted sip with a chocolate whisper.

Shake port, cream, and sugar with ice until it thickens like a vintage fog—egg optional for extra heft. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, dust with nutmeg—a rich, hand-crafted flip with a sailor’s heart.

Shake dark rum, orgeat syrup, orange juice, and pineapple juice with ice until it roars with island soul. Pour into a large glass over fresh ice, dash bitters atop, and garnish with a cherry and pineapple—a hand-crafted punch with a planter’s grit.

Rim a Collins glass with lime and salt, a desert’s dusty kiss. Fill with ice, pour tequila, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and pineapple soda, stirring quick and light. Garnish with pineapple or lime—a hand-crafted Paloma with a tropical twist.

Shake vodka, Passoa, passion fruit juice, and lime with ice until it hums with cheeky flair. Strain into a chilled martini glass, garnish with half a passion fruit. Serve prosecco in a shot glass on the side—a hand-crafted tease with a bubbly chaser.
Layer grenadine into a pousse-cafe glass, a ruby base. Float creme de menthe atop with a steady hand, keeping the green aloft. Serve unmixed—a hand-crafted beacon of red and green.
Stir port and brandy with ice until it chills deep and smooth. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip with a rich, quiet swagger.
Shake orange juice, apple juice, and pineapple juice with ice until it hums with a sunny buzz. Pour into a Collins glass—a hand-crafted, juice-packed lift.
Shake Sprite, pink lemonade, and vodka with ice until it’s a wild, fizzy mess. Pour into a Collins glass—a hand-crafted party starter with a cheeky grin.
Stir vodka, sugar syrup, and passion fruit juice in a glass until it hums with tropical soul. Garnish with half a passion fruit—a hand-crafted sip that’s pure and fierce.
Toss ginger and pineapple juice into a blender, whirring it into a zesty blur. Pour into a highball glass—a quick, hand-crafted quench with a spicy kick.
Shake dark rum, Kahlua, and cream with ice until it hums with a director’s flair. Strain into a cocktail glass, dust with nutmeg—a hand-crafted sip with a brooding twist.
Shake coffee brandy, lime vodka, and sherry with ice until it buzzes with regal poise. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sting with a queen’s grace.
Layer Kahlua into a shot glass, a dark base. Add Midori next, then top with Baileys—a swift, hand-crafted trio that’s bold and brash.
Pour black sambuca into a highball glass, then flood it with pulpy orange juice, quick and messy to mix the dark with the bright. A hand-crafted sinker with a citrus pull.
Pour red wine and grenadine over ice in a Collins glass, then fill with lemon-lime soda, stirring with a royal flick. A hand-crafted fizz with a regal blush.
Stir dry vermouth, gin, and Benedictine with ice until it hums with a monarch’s poise. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip fit for a crown.
Shake light rum, brandy, lemon juice, and raspberry syrup with ice until it hums with a quiet fervor. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip with a humble kick.
Stir light rum, sherry, and lime juice with ice until it chills with a sailor’s calm. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip from the ship’s deck.
Toss red wine, peach schnapps, Pepsi, and orange juice into a beer mug with ice, stirring rough and cold. A hand-crafted mash-up that’s bold and unpolished.
Build prosecco and Campari over ice in an old-fashioned glass, splash with soda water. Garnish with an orange slice—a hand-crafted fizz with Venetian vibes.
Shake brandy, amaretto, and cream with cracked ice until it hums smooth and quick. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip with a zippy soul.

Mix red wine, sugar, orange juice, and lemon juice in a pitcher, chilling it down with a Spanish sun’s patience. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste, then serve in wine glasses—a hand-crafted fiesta in every pour.
Pour Absolut Vodka, Cranberry Juice, and Grapefruit Juice over ice in a highball glass. Stir gently and garnish with a Lime Peel—a breezy, artisanal coastal sip.
Stir brandy and creme de menthe with ice in a mixing glass until it chills with a sharp bite. Strain into a cocktail glass—or serve on rocks if you dare—a hand-crafted sting with a cool finish.

Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with absinthe, swirling its herbal bite, then toss in crushed ice to wait. Stir bourbon, sugar, bitters, and water over ice with a steady hand. Dump the ice and absinthe excess, strain the mix into the glass, and twist a lemon peel over it—a hand-crafted N’awlins legend with a sharp soul.
Shake cognac, Cointreau, and lemon juice with ice in a shaker, hard and fast like a wartime ride. Strain into a cocktail glass, chilled and crisp—a hand-crafted classic with a smooth, tart kick.

Stir vodka, Amaro Montenegro, ruby port, and blood orange juice with ice until it hums with a winter’s chill. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice, express an orange peel over it, and drop it in—a hand-crafted sip for snowy nights.

Simmer sugar, water, and allspice until the sugar melts into a spiced syrup, then cool and strain through a coffee filter. Shake 60 ml of this syrup with rum and lime juice over ice, strain into six flute glasses, and top with champagne. Twist an orange peel over each—a hand-crafted holiday sparkler.

Drop one ice cube into a highball glass, pour in Advocaat with a festive wink, and fill with lemonade, fizzing like a winter flurry. Garnish with a lemon slice—a hand-crafted snowball that’s creamy and bright.
Layer Jim Beam and Jack Daniels in a shot glass, then float Wild Turkey atop with a steady hand. A hand-crafted triple-barrel blast of bourbon bravado—shoot it fast.

Rim a highball glass with salt, then fill with ice cubes. Pour grapefruit juice and gin over, stirring with a sailor’s grit. A hand-crafted bite with a briny edge—swap gin for vodka if you’re feeling rogue.
Shake apricot brandy, orange juice, and sweet-and-sour mix with ice until it hums with a fruity tang. Strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass—a hand-crafted sip with a stone-cold edge.
Build vodka, cranberry juice, and grapefruit juice over ice in a highball glass, stirring with a coastal breeze. Garnish with a lime wedge—a hand-crafted refresher with a salty-air vibe.

Shake scotch, lime juice, and powdered sugar with ice until it sings with a Highland tang. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, garnish with half a lemon slice and a cherry—a hand-crafted sour with a smoky soul.
Pour two shots of Godiva liqueur into a highball glass, then top with milk to your sweet liking—a hand-crafted treat for the candy-hearted, simple and smooth.
Pour vodka over ice in a highball glass, fill with orange juice, and stir with a worker’s grunt. Garnish with an orange slice—a hand-crafted classic, simple and strong.
Shake sherry, cream, and sugar with ice until it thickens with a vintage glow—egg optional for heft. Strain into a Nick and Nora glass, dust with nutmeg—a hand-crafted flip with a silky swagger.
Shake brandy and anisette with ice, strain into a brandy snifter—a hand-crafted dance of sun and shade, warm and bold with a Spanish twist.

Mix lemonade and water per the can’s call—4 1/3 cans of water if it says so—then blend into a pitcher with vodka. Stir with a predator’s grin, pour over crushed ice—a hand-crafted frenzy that bites back.

Drop ice into a tall glass, pour vodka and creme de banane, then fill with orange juice. Carefully drizzle grenadine down the side to settle at the bottom, garnish with orange and strawberry—a hand-crafted taste of the Bay, layered and wild.

Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in Bacardi and Malibu shots, splash with pineapple juice, and top with orange juice. Add a drop of grenadine for cosmic color, garnish with cherries—a hand-crafted voyage with a tropical orbit.
Shake sherry, sugar, and egg with ice until it thickens with a holiday hum—egg optional. Strain into a Collins glass, fill with milk, stir, and dust with nutmeg—a hand-crafted nog with a sherry glow.
Blend milk, banana, and honey in a jar until it whirs into a creamy dream. Pour into a highball glass—or split into smaller ones—a hand-crafted smoothie with a sweet, simple soul.
Dissolve sugar in hot water, cool it down, then mix with red wine, citrus wedges, and Fresca in a pitcher. Chill for hours, letting the fruit steep—a hand-crafted sangria with a sweet, fizzy heart.
Shake scotch, wine, and orange juice with ice until it hums with a midnight groove. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip with a thrilling edge.
Mix dark rum, Campari, and creme de banane, then top with pineapple and lime juice in a Collins glass—a hand-crafted outback brew, dark and wild with a tropical bite.

Boil water, sugar, and coffee for 10 minutes, stirring until it thickens with a roaster’s patience, then cool. Add rum and vanilla, bottle it up, and let it sit a week—a hand-crafted coffee liqueur with a pirate’s grin.

Stir Irish whiskey, sweet vermouth, and green Chartreuse over ice until it hums with an emerald lilt. Strain into a chilled Nick and Nora glass, express an orange peel over it—a hand-crafted Irish nod with a bold twist.
Shake Wild Turkey, amaretto, and a splash of pineapple juice with ice, strain into a shot glass—a hand-crafted bourbon blast with a nutty-sweet finish.

Blend Kahlua, Irish cream, amaretto, 151 rum, and cream with ice until it’s smooth as a Lone Star sunset. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whipped cream—a hand-crafted Texas twister with a boozy drawl.

Brew coffee with coriander and cardamom in a filter cone, let it cool with a Bangkok breeze. Dissolve sugar in a splash of coffee, add ice to a highball glass, pour coffee over, and float cream atop—a hand-crafted Thai brew with a spiced drift.

Shake gin, lemon juice, and sugar with ice until it hums with a gentleman’s poise. Strain into a Collins glass near-full of ice, top with club soda, stir, and garnish with a cherry and orange slice—a hand-crafted refresher with a timeless strut.
Blend tomato juice, lemon juice, and celery salt until it whirs with a garden’s bite. Pour into a highball glass—or split into smaller ones—a hand-crafted tang with a savory punch.
Pour Grand Marnier into a brandy snifter, then top with hot coffee—a hand-crafted fusion of citrus and caffeine, bold and warm.
Mix coffee, Jack Daniels, and amaretto in a mug, then float cream on top—a hand-crafted Tennessee brew, dark and boozy with a smooth finish.

Shake tequila, lemon juice, and grenadine with ice until it hums with a desert spark—egg white optional. Strain into a Collins glass over ice, top with ginger ale, stir—a hand-crafted fizz with a tequila twist.

Shake tequila, lemon juice, and sugar with ice until it bites with a sour sting. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, garnish with half a lemon slice and a cherry—a hand-crafted agave twist on a classic.

Mix Thai tea powder with boiling water and condensed milk, stirring until it blends with a street vendor’s rhythm. Pour into two ice-filled highball glasses, garnish with mint—a hand-crafted Thai cooler, sweet and bold.
Shake green Chartreuse, maraschino liqueur, lime juice, and gin with ice until it hums with a final say. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted Prohibition-era zinger, sharp and unforgettable.

Stir dry vermouth, gin, and anis with ice until it hums with a racetrack’s edge—bitters omitted for a cleaner run. Strain into a cocktail glass, twist an orange peel over it—a hand-crafted sip with a jockey’s poise.

Squeeze two lime wedges into a balloon glass, drop in elderflower cordial, gin, and rosso vermouth, swirling with a gentleman’s finesse. Pack with cubed ice, stir to chill, then top with ginger ale, stirring again. Snap a ginger slice and awaken a mint sprig for garnish—a hand-crafted elixir with a crisp, botanical lift.
Pour tequila into a shot glass, top with 7-Up, and mix gently to keep the fizz alive. Slam it back—a hand-crafted jolt with a rowdy kick.

Pour tequila over ice in a highball glass, fill with orange juice, then let grenadine sink to the bottom, stirring gently for that sunrise glow. Garnish with an orange slice—a hand-crafted dawn in a glass.

Shake gin, melon liqueur, orange bitters, and lemon juice with ice—Hendricks if you’re wise—then strain into a Margarita glass. Top with prosecco for a contemplative fizz—a hand-crafted sip for deep thoughts.

Stir dry vermouth, gin, maraschino liqueur, and anis with ice until it hums with a tailored chill—bitters omitted for elegance. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a cherry and lemon zest twist—a hand-crafted classic in black-tie glory.
Fill a shot glass with tequila, then drop in a few dashes of Tabasco—a hand-crafted surprise with a fiery sting. Slam it quick.

Brew strong coffee with cardamom, sweeten while hot, then cool it fast. Pour over ice in a highball glass, float cream atop with a spoon for that layered look—a hand-crafted Thai brew with a spiced chill.
Fill a whiskey sour glass with ice, pour in Irish whiskey and amaretto, then top with cranberry juice. Garnish with a lemon slice—a hand-crafted mobster’s sip, smooth with a sharp finish.
Shake Yukon Jack, cherry brandy, Southern Comfort, and a splash of sweet-and-sour with ice until it rattles with a Texas bite. Pour into a shot glass—a hand-crafted venom, sweet then sharp.
Shake gin, vodka, and Lillet Blanc with ice until it’s chilled to a spy’s core. Strain into a deep goblet, garnish with a thin lemon peel slice—a hand-crafted Bond classic, sleek and lethal.
Shake gin, sweet vermouth, and brandy with ice until it hums with a victor’s swagger. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted trio with a bold finish.

Rim an old-fashioned glass with salt, fill halfway with ice, and pour in tequila. Squeeze a lime, sprinkle a pinch of salt, then add tomato juice, orange juice, and a dash of sugar syrup. Stir gently—a hand-crafted Mexican bloodbath with a salty bite.

Shake light rum, sweet vermouth, lemon juice, and sugar with ice until it erupts with a volcanic hum—egg white optional. Strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice—a hand-crafted Italian flare with a citrus glow.
Pour dark rum and cherry brandy over ice in an old-fashioned glass, stir with a soldier’s steady hand—a hand-crafted veteran’s sip, bold and deep.
Shake light rum, maple syrup, and lemon juice with ice until it hums with a woodsman’s charm. Strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice—a hand-crafted pour with a sweet, tart bite.
Blend vodka, half-and-half, and limeade with ice until it whirs with a frothy buzz. Pour into a large white wine glass, sprinkle nutmeg atop—a hand-crafted fizz with a creamy lift.
Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in vodka and lemon juice, stir with a bar spoon. Garnish with a lemon slice and mint if you’re feeling it—a hand-crafted zinger, simple and bright.
Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in vodka and Sprite, then finish with lime juice—a hand-crafted slime with a fizzy, tart edge.
Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in vodka, top with tonic water, squeeze a lime wedge in, and garnish with a slice—a hand-crafted refresher, clean and simple.
Shake vodka and dry vermouth with ice until it chills with a spy’s precision. Strain into a cocktail glass, drop in an olive—a hand-crafted martini, crisp and unflinching.
Pour vodka into a Collins glass over ice, fill with Schweppes Russchian, stir simply—a hand-crafted Russian twist, light and fizzy.
Stir dry vermouth and creme de cassis with ice in a highball glass, fill with carbonated water, stir again—a hand-crafted French fizz with a berry kiss.

Shake vodka, lemon juice, grape juice, and sugar with ice until it sings with a victor’s cheer. Strain into a Collins glass over ice, garnish with an orange slice—a hand-crafted Collins with a triumphant twist.
Pour vodka over ice in a highball glass, fill with tonic water, stir with a casual flick—a hand-crafted staple, crisp and no-nonsense.
Shake apricot brandy and orange juice with ice until it hums with a Spanish sun—bitters omitted for simplicity. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip with a citrus bloom.
Pour scotch and wine into a Collins glass, no ice, blending their warmth with a Highlander’s nod—a hand-crafted duo, bold and un chilled.
Shake gin, triple sec, and lemon juice with ice until it glows with a lady’s grace. Strain into a large cocktail glass—a hand-crafted classic, sharp and elegant.
Mix red wine, lemon juice, orange juice, and pineapple juice, then pour over a block of ice in a pitcher—a hand-crafted punch with a fruity, chilled soul.
Mix red wine and lemon-lime soda, pour into a Collins glass, add ice—a hand-crafted cooler, light and fizzy with a wine whisper.
Rim a highball glass with salt, shake tequila, Campari, lime juice, orange juice, and rosemary syrup with ice, then strain over fresh ice—a hand-crafted margarita with a winter’s edge.

Shake whiskey, lemon juice, and sugar with ice until it bites with a sour sting. Strain into a chilled old-fashioned glass—or over ice if you’re rocking it—garnish with a cherry and lemon slice—a hand-crafted classic with a whiskey heart.
Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice in an old-fashioned glass, fill with cream, and let it swirl—a hand-crafted dude’s delight, rich and smooth.
Infuse tequila with Timur Pepper, then mix with grapefruit juice, lime juice, and agave syrup in a highball glass. Dash in Himalayan spice—a hand-crafted Paloma with a citrusy, numbing winter bite.

Chop lemon, lime, strawberries, and apple into chunks, toss into a pitcher with white wine and apple brandy. Top with soda water to taste, let it chill—a hand-crafted Spanish sangria, light and fruity.
Blend ice, tequila, cream of coconut, and lime juice until it hums smooth as a coastal wave. Pour into a margarita glass—a hand-crafted tropical twist with a creamy crest.
Shake triple sec, gin, and pineapple juice with ice until it sways with a beachside breeze. Strain into a cocktail glass—a hand-crafted sip of Hawaiian dusk.
Shake white rum, Galliano, triple sec, and lime juice with ice until it chirps with a Caribbean lilt. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass—a hand-crafted island flyer, bright and bold.
Blend yoghurt and fruit with ice until it whirs into a frosty blur—add extra cubes mid-blend for a chill blast. Pour into a highball glass—a hand-crafted cooler for scorching days.
Pour sambuca, Baileys, and white creme de menthe into a coffee mug, fill with black coffee, and crown with whipped cream—a hand-crafted masked avenger with a boozy kick.
Pour peachtree schnapps and Surge into a highball glass, slam it back fast—a hand-crafted zinger with a fizzy, peach-powered punch.
Pour beer, root beer, lemonade, Coke, 7-Up, and creme de cassis into a pilsner glass, toss in a lemon slice—no rules, just chaos—a hand-crafted mash-up with a wild fizz.

Blend rums, Pernod, grenadine, and lime juice with ice for a quick 5-second roar. Pour into a hurricane glass, fill with ice cubes, garnish with a lime—a hand-crafted tiki beast with a staggering punch.
Mix sambuca with root beer over ice in a Collins glass, stir with a rogue’s grin—a hand-crafted brew with a dark, fizzy soul.
Shake vodka and ouzo with ice like a martini with a Greek twist, strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a green olive—a hand-crafted zinger with an anise bite.
Mix Jägermeister and root beer in a Collins glass, sip with a meditative calm—a hand-crafted zen brew with a herbal fizz.
Fill a whiskey sour glass with ice, add a straw, then layer Chambord, vodka, and soda water—keep it stacked if you can. A hand-crafted shot with a zippy descent.
Fill a hurricane glass with ice, pour in Chambord, then top with Zima, mixing with a blast of flair—a hand-crafted retro rocket with a berry boom.
Pour Cointreau over ice in a margarita glass, add lemon juice, stir gently, and drop in lemon slices—a hand-crafted French quack with a citrus zing.
Pour Zima over ice in a Collins glass, add Midori on top—no stirring, let it sit. Garnish with a cherry—a hand-crafted zinger with a melon glow.
Mix Kool-Aid to taste, add rum and amaretto, shake until the sugar dissolves into a wild blur. Serve cold in an old-fashioned glass—a hand-crafted rebel with a sugary sting.
Pour vermouth and apple juice into a Collins glass, no ice, at room temp for a smooth sip—a hand-crafted German twist with an apple glow.
Pour 151 rum and Wild Turkey into a shot glass, shoot it fast—a hand-crafted double-barrel blast to get you gone quick.
Shake Goldschlager, Jägermeister, Rumple Minze, and 151 rum with ice, pour into a shot glass—a hand-crafted golden nightmare with a brutal shine.
Pour Jack Daniels, Johnnie Walker, and Jim Beam into a shot glass, slam it back—a hand-crafted trio of whiskey wisdom with a righteous kick.

Fill a Collins glass with ice, pour in gin, rum, tequila, triple sec, and vodka, then hit it with cola and sweet-and-sour. Dash bitters on top, garnish with a lemon wedge—a hand-crafted monster with a marathon punch.
Pour peach vodka into a Collins glass, fill with cola, mix with a quick flick—a hand-crafted vanish with a peachy fizz.
Mix equal parts Blue Curacao, blueberry schnapps, vodka, sour mix, and 7-Up over ice in a Collins glass—a hand-crafted blue blast with a bold buzz.

strDrink: 57 Chevy with a White License Plate
strInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in white creme de cacao and vodka, stir with a retro rumble—a hand-crafted classic with a sleek, white shine.
Pour gin and 7-Up into a Collins glass, add lemon juice for a zesty kick—top with more 7-Up if you’re tame—a hand-crafted fizz with a cheeky wink.
Pour Kahlua, Baileys, and Frangelico into a shot glass—no chill, no layers—just slam it back—a hand-crafted flight with a turbulent landing.
Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in vodka, lime cordial, and cranberry juice, top with Sprite, garnish with a lime wheel—a hand-crafted takeoff with a fruity soar.
Chill Absolut Citron, orange curacao, strawberry liqueur, and orange juice in a mixer, strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a strawberry slice—a hand-crafted tease with a sultry edge.
